TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TickBar extends System.Windows.FrameworkElement
.class public auto ansi TickBar extends System.Windows.FrameworkElement

Docs.summary: Represents a control that draws a set of tick marks for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> control draws tick marks that have a width of one pixel. You can define the location of the tick marks by specifying a repeating interval or a series of explicit points.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> control is specifically designed to work with a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control. A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> displays tick marks. The following illustration shows a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> that has a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar>.
**Slider with a TickBar**
![Slider illustration](~/add/media/genericslider.png "Slider illustration")
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> controls are typically defined in the <xref:System.Windows.Style> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider>. For an example of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> that is included in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> <xref:System.Windows.Style>, see [Slider Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/slider-styles-and-templates.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> controls both contain properties that perform the same function. The following table shows the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> properties and the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> properties to which they are bound. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> properties take precedence when <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> properties that are related are both specified.
**Related TickBar and Slider Properties**
|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar> property|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> property| |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.IsDirectionReversed%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.IsDirectionReversed%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.IsSelectionRangeEnabled%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.IsSelectionRangeEnabled%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.Maximum%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.Minimum%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Minimum%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.SelectionEnd%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.SelectionEnd%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.SelectionStart%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.SelectionStart%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.TickFrequency%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.TickFrequency%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.Ticks%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.Ticks%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value that is possible for a tick mark.
Docs.value: The largest possible value for a tick mark. The default value is 100.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Primary ticks are displayed for the and values, and secondary ticks are displayed for other values. For a horizontal , the height of the primary ticks is equal to the of the . For a vertical , the width of the primary ticks is equal to the of the . The size of the secondary ticks is 75 percent of the size of the primary ticks. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

Protected Overrides Sub OnRender (dc As DrawingContext)

Docs.param: The that is used to draw the ticks.
Docs.summary: Draws the tick marks for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.Placement%2A> property and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.IsDirectionReversed%2A> property determine where tick marks are drawn in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar>.
Primary ticks are displayed for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.Maximum%2A> values, and secondary ticks are displayed for other values. For a horizontal <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar>, the height of the primary ticks is equal to the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualHeight%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar>. For a vertical <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar>, the width of the primary ticks is equal to the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualWidth%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar>. The size of the secondary ticks is 75 percent of the size of the primary ticks.
This method also draws ticks at the beginning and the end of a selection range if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.IsSelectionRangeEnabled%2A> property is `true` and if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.SelectionStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TickBar.SelectionEnd%2A> properties are valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Controls::Primitives::TickBarPlacement Placement { System::Windows::Controls::Primitives::TickBarPlacement get(); void set(System::Windows::Controls::Primitives::TickBarPlacement value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets where tick marks appear relative to a of a control.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that identifies the position of the in the layout of a . The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value is used to make sure that the visible parts of the , such as the end point indicators of a selection range, are displayed correctly. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double ReservedSpace { double get(); void set(double value); };
member this.ReservedSpace : double with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a space buffer for the area that contains the tick marks that are specified for a .
Docs.value: A value that represents the total buffer area on either side of the row or column of tick marks. The default value is zero (0.0).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The space buffer that is defined by the property is designed to account for the space that the control uses when it is at either end of the . The value of the property is divided in half. One half of the space is used as a buffer on one side of the tick mark collection, and the other half of the space is used as a buffer on the other side of the collection. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the interval between tick marks.
Docs.value: The distance between tick marks. The default value is one (1.0).

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the property is set to a value that is not `null`, the property is not used. Tick marks are drawn at the interval that is specified by the property, starting at the value of the property and continuing until the value of the property is reached. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the positions of the tick marks.
Docs.value: A that specifies the locations of the tick marks. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Tick marks that are defined by the property and that are outside the range that is defined by the and property values do not appear. When the property is set, the property is not used. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
